articles.headline: Risqué Names Reap Rewards for Some Companies
articles.snippet: Nowadays, the bar for grabbing attention has moved higher — or, more precisely, lower.
articles.abstract: Nowadays, the bar for grabbing attention has moved higher — or, more precisely, lower.
articles.lead_paragraph: Corin and Brian Mullins thought they had a good name for their debut product, a nonallergenic, high-fiber breakfast cereal, until a supremely satisfied customer called to praise the product’s effectiveness.

articles.headline: Facebook Profit Tripled in First Quarter
articles.snippet: The company reported 1.28 billion monthly users, most on mobile devices, and easily exceeded analysts’ expectations for revenue and profit.
articles.abstract: The company reported 1.28 billion monthly users, most on mobile devices, and easily exceeded analysts’ expectations for revenue and profit.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — As Facebook reported another quarter of strong revenue and profit growth on Wednesday, its executives made one thing very clear: The company’s money machine has just begun to spit out the cash.

articles.headline: Apple’s Profit Still Climbs, but Pressure is Growing
articles.snippet: The slowdown in earnings has put pressure on the company to release products in new categories — perhaps with a so-called smart watch.
articles.abstract: The slowdown in earnings has put pressure on the company to release products in new categories — perhaps with a so-called smart watch.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple’s remarkable growth streak — now more than a decade old — is starting to fade a little.

articles.headline: F.C.C., in a Shift, Backs Fast Lanes for Web Traffic
articles.snippet: Planned new rules would allow an Internet provider to negotiate separately with content companies like Disney or Google and charge for priority service.
articles.abstract: Planned new rules would allow an Internet provider to negotiate separately with content companies like Disney or Google and charge for priority service.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The principle that all Internet content should be treated equally as it flows through cables and pipes to consumers looks all but dead.

articles.headline: Conjuring Images of a Bionic Future
articles.snippet: As they work more closely with our mobile computers, devices that once simply fixed whatever ailed us will begin to do much more.
articles.abstract: As they work more closely with our mobile computers, devices that once simply fixed whatever ailed us will begin to do much more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dick Loizeaux recently found himself meandering through a noisy New York nightclub. This was unusual; Mr. Loizeaux, a 65-year-old former pastor, began suffering hearing loss nearly a decade ago, and nightclubs are not really his scene. “They’re the absolute worst place to hear anybody talk,” he said.

articles.headline: Strict Cost-Cutters Who Want to Spend $45 Billion on a Takeover
articles.snippet: Valeant’s chief, J. Michael Pearson, has slimmed down the pharmaceuticals company, but been an aggressive acquirer, spending more than $19 billion on companies.
articles.abstract: Valeant’s chief, J. Michael Pearson, has slimmed down the pharmaceuticals company, but been an aggressive acquirer, spending more than $19 billion on companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Visitors to the New Jersey offices of Valeant, the ambitious pharmaceuticals company, are confronted with an unusual sight when they walk through the front door: a basketball court.

articles.headline: A Defiant Rancher Savors the Audience That Rallied to His Side
articles.snippet: For now, Cliven Bundy appears to have won his standoff with the federal government over cattle grazing in Nevada. But if the authorities have moved on, Mr. Bundy has not.
articles.abstract: For now, Cliven Bundy appears to have won his standoff with the federal government over cattle grazing in Nevada. But if the authorities have moved on, Mr. Bundy has not.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUNKERVILLE, Nev. — Cliven Bundy stood by the Virgin River up the road from the armed checkpoint at the driveway of his ranch, signing autographs and posing for pictures. For 55 minutes, Mr. Bundy held forth to a clutch of supporters about his views on the troubled state of America — the overreaching federal government, the harassment of Western ranchers, the societal upheaval caused by abortion, even musing about whether slavery was so bad.

articles.headline: F.B.I. Informant Is Tied to Cyberattacks Abroad
articles.snippet: While it is unclear whether the F.B.I. ordered the attacks by Hector Xavier Monsegur, the agency may have used hackers to gather intelligence even as investigators were trying to dismantle hacking groups.
articles.abstract: While it is unclear whether the F.B.I. ordered the attacks by Hector Xavier Monsegur, the agency may have used hackers to gather intelligence even as investigators were trying to dismantle hacking groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An informant working for the F.B.I. coordinated a 2012 campaign of hundreds of cyberattacks on foreign websites, including some operated by the governments of Iran, Syria, Brazil and Pakistan, according to documents and interviews with people involved in the attacks.

articles.headline: Americans Die in Grim Trend in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: Officials said the gunman appeared to be a police officer who reacted when seeing a group of Americans, raising fears of a new wave of shootings spurred by deepening Afghan resentment.
articles.abstract: Officials said the gunman appeared to be a police officer who reacted when seeing a group of Americans, raising fears of a new wave of shootings spurred by deepening Afghan resentment.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Three Americans were killed at a private hospital in Kabul on Thursday morning when an Afghan police officer turned his gun on them, officials said, in the latest in a string of attacks against Western civilians here.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Obama Suffers Setbacks in Japan and the Mideast
articles.snippet: While offering security assurances to Japan, President Obama did not take sides over who has sovereignty over islands that are also claimed by China.
articles.abstract: While offering security assurances to Japan, President Obama did not take sides over who has sovereignty over islands that are also claimed by China.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — President Obama encountered setbacks to two of his most cherished foreign-policy projects on Thursday, as he failed to achieve a trade deal that undergirds his strategic pivot to Asia and the Middle East peace process suffered a potentially irreparable breakdown.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Jodi Rudoren

articles.headline: Bare Knuckles at Sotheby’s Auction House
articles.snippet: Daniel S. Loeb, the biggest shareholder of Sotheby’s, has nominated himself and two others to the board of the auction house, which holds its annual meeting on May 6.
articles.abstract: Daniel S. Loeb, the biggest shareholder of Sotheby’s, has nominated himself and two others to the board of the auction house, which holds its annual meeting on May 6.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:24 p.m. | Directors of Sotheby’s gathered in their wood-paneled boardroom with an urgent goal: how to mollify Daniel S. Loeb, the outspoken hedge fund mogul who is the auction house’s largest shareholder.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Michael J. de la Merced
